intro: Cola letestui, commonly known as the African kola nut, is a tropical evergreen tree native to western Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces large, woody pods that contain the aromatic kola nuts used in traditional ceremonies and as a stimulant. Cola letestui thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its ecological significance includes supporting various wildlife species and contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
